p: Given that pandemic influenzas appear to have a zoonotic origin, cross-species surveillance (a One Health approach) is essential. The number of reported novel influenza A virus infections in humans has increased over 30-fold in the past 20 years [ 23]. This is due, in part, to the ever increasing and well connected human population and the global expansion of domestic poultry and pig populations. Many subtypes of novel influenza A viruses have emerged from these animal reservoirs to cause zoonotic infections.
